## 1. Binomial Distribution

```python
import numpy as np
from scipy.stats import binom
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

np.random.seed(1)
binom_data = np.random.binomial(n=5, p=0.3, size=1000)
print(np.bincount(binom_data))

# P(X = 3)
print(binom.pmf(3, n=5, p=0.3))

# P(X <= 3)
print(binom.cdf(3, n=5, p=0.3))

# Plot
plt.hist(binom_data, bins=np.arange(7)-0.5, edgecolor="black")
plt.title("Binomial Distribution")
plt.xlabel("Number of Successes")
plt.ylabel("Frequency")
plt.show()
```

## 2. Chi-Square Test (Titanic dataset)

```python
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
from scipy.stats import chi2_contingency

titanic = sns.load_dataset("titanic")
table = pd.crosstab(titanic['sex'], titanic['class'])

chi2_stat, p, dof, expected = chi2_contingency(table)
print("Chi-square Statistic:", chi2_stat)
print("p-value:", p)

table.plot(kind='bar', stacked=True)
plt.title("Observed Frequencies")
plt.ylabel("Count")
plt.show()
```

## 3. Student's t-Distribution

```python
from scipy.stats import ttest_ind

np.random.seed(2)
group1 = np.random.normal(50, 5, 10)
group2 = np.random.normal(55, 5, 10)

# T-test
t_stat, p_val = ttest_ind(group1, group2)
print("T-statistic:", t_stat, "p-value:", p_val)

# Histograms
plt.hist(group1, alpha=0.5, label='Group 1')
plt.hist(group2, alpha=0.5, label='Group 2')
plt.legend()
plt.title("Group Distributions")
plt.show()
```

## 4. F-Distribution / ANOVA

```python
from scipy.stats import f_oneway

np.random.seed(3)
groupA = np.random.normal(70, 5, 10)
groupB = np.random.normal(75, 5, 10)
groupC = np.random.normal(80, 5, 10)

f_stat, p_val = f_oneway(groupA, groupB, groupC)
print("F-statistic:", f_stat)
print("p-value:", p_val)
```

## 5. Poisson, Exponential, Weibull

```python
from scipy.stats import poisson, expon, weibull_min

np.random.seed(4)

# Poisson
pois_data = poisson.rvs(mu=3, size=100)
plt.hist(pois_data, bins=10, color='lightblue', edgecolor='black')
plt.title("Poisson (Î»=3)")
plt.show()

# Exponential
exp_data = expon.rvs(scale=2, size=100)
plt.hist(exp_data, bins=10, color='lightgreen', edgecolor='black')
plt.title("Exponential (rate=0.5)")
plt.show()

# Weibull
weib_data = weibull_min.rvs(c=1.5, scale=5, size=100)
plt.hist(weib_data, bins=10, color='salmon', edgecolor='black')
plt.title("Weibull Distribution")
plt.show()
```
